Trigeminy and bigeminy describe patterns of premature ventricular contractions (PVCs) that occur in threes or twos, respectively.   The patient's PSVT was completed with the use of medication and cardioversion. The patient also had a history of AV-nodal reentry tachycardia (AVNRT), which is another type of PSVT that occurs due to a "circuit" that develops in the atria.   The patient's discharge instructions included monitoring their pulse rate and symptoms, adhering to medication regimen, and following up with the cardiologist in two weeks. The patient was also advised to avoid triggers that may lead to vasovagal or junctional reactions, which are both types of arrhythmias that can cause a drop in blood pressure and fainting. The patient was counseled on avoiding activities that may exacerbate their arrhythmia and understanding how to monitor their own symptoms.
